questions.question: Hi!
questions.answer: Hi, how are you?

questions.question: Good, how are you?
questions.answer: Good, thanks for asking!

questions.question: Good
questions.answer: Me too!

questions.question: Hello!
questions.answer: Heyyyy!

questions.question: What's my favorite color?
questions.answer: Green

questions.question: What is the largest organ in the human body?
questions.answer: The skin is the largest organ in the human body.

questions.question: How many bones are there in the adult human skeleton?
questions.answer: The adult human skeleton is made up of 206 bones.

questions.question: What is the name of the gland that produces hormones that regulate vital body functions?
questions.answer: The pituitary gland produces hormones.

questions.question: The human heart has four chambers - the right atrium, right ventricle, left atrium, and left ventricle.
questions.answer: The human heart has four chambers - the right atrium, right ventricle, left atrium, and left ventricle.

questions.question: What is the name of the membrane that surrounds and protects the brain and spinal cord?
questions.answer: The meninges is the membrane that surrounds and protects the brain and spinal cord.

questions.question: How many permanent teeth does an adult human have?
questions.answer: An adult human has 32 permanent teeth.

questions.question: Can you help me?
questions.answer: Sure, what do you need help with?

questions.question: I have some questions about the human body.
questions.answer: Okay, ask away!

questions.question: How do humans build muscle?
questions.answer: The body repairs damaged fibers by fusing them, which increases the mass and size of the muscles.

questions.question: What are the best ways to get over the flu?
questions.answer: For most healthy children and adults, home care is the best way to treat flu. This includes rest, drinking plenty of fluids, and, if needed, taking over-the-counter medications to lower fevers or reduce muscle pain.

questions.question: How can I build muscle?
questions.answer: Go to the gym at least twice a week and work out specific muscle groups. Be sure to eat enough calorically and consume enough protein to repair tears in your muscles after working out.

questions.question: How can I live a healthier life?
questions.answer: Make sure you are eating whole, unprocessed foods throughout the day. Exercise and drink water, and you will see incredible health shifts!

questions.question: What allergies do I have?
questions.answer: Pollen and tree nuts

questions.question: What is the importance of hand washing?
questions.answer: Washing your hands regularly with soap and water is one of the most effective ways to prevent the spread of germs and infectious diseases.

questions.question: How can I maintain a healthy diet?
questions.answer: Focus on eating a variety of nutrient-dense foods like fruits, vegetables, whole grains, lean proteins, and healthy fats.

questions.question: What are the benefits of exercise?
questions.answer: Regular physical activity can improve cardiovascular health, strengthen muscles and bones, boost mood and mental wellbeing, control weight, and reduce the risk of chronic diseases like diabetes and some cancers.

questions.question: How do I perform basic first aid?
questions.answer: Basic first aid includes stopping bleeding, treating burns, caring for sprains and fractures, performing CPR, and responding to other common emergencies.

questions.question: What is the normal body temperature for a healthy adult?
questions.answer: The normal body temperature range is typically 97째F (36.1째C) to 99째F (37.2째C).

questions.question: How often should you get a physical exam?
questions.answer: It is recommended to get a routine physical exam once a year, or as advised by your healthcare provider.

questions.question: What are the common symptoms of the flu?
questions.answer: Common flu symptoms include fever, cough, sore throat, body aches, headaches, fatigue, and in some cases, vomiting and diarrhea.

questions.question: How can you prevent the spread of the common cold?
questions.answer: Preventive measures include washing your hands frequently, avoiding touching your face, and covering your coughs and sneezes.

questions.question: What is the difference between a cold and the flu?
questions.answer: The flu typically causes more severe symptoms, such as higher fever, body aches, and potential complications, compared to the common cold.
